oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - American Ace - 1947-11-22 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of excerpts from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (7:30-8:00 pm) from November 22, 1947. Featuring Grant Turner (host/announcer), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Sonny Day, Art Gibson, Pap's Jug Band, Jimmy Riddle, and Uncle Dave Macon with his son Dorris. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Tommy Jackson; Sonny Day
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: American Ace Coffee commercial -- You Are My Sunshine (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Bashful Brother Oswald -- Thought I Heard That K. C. Whistle Blow (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff talks -- American Ace Coffee commercial (Roy Acuff, Grant Turner) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson -- Fire On The Mountain (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Rockin' Alone (In An Old Rocking Chair) (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Sonny Day -- [Unidentified instrumental] (Sonny Day accordion) -- Roy Acuff introduces Art Gibson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Jackson, Tommy; Day, Sonny (Accordionist); Wilson, Lonnie; Easterday, Jess; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Turner, Grant;
